name: Pistol Squat Right
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Lift your left leg slightly in front of you, keeping it straight. This will be the non-working leg.
3. Extend your arms out in front of you at shoulder height for balance.
4. Slowly lower your body by bending your right knee and hinging at your hips, keeping your chest up and back straight.
5. Continue lowering until your right thigh is parallel to the ground, or as low as you can go while maintaining balance and control.
6. Keep your left leg extended throughout the movement and avoid letting it touch the ground.
7. Push through your right heel to stand back up to the starting position, fully extending your right leg.
8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions with the right leg before switching to the left (if performing both sides).
short_summary: The pistol squat is a single-leg squat exercise performed on the right leg, improving balance and strengthening the lower body.
